column1: Fellow at the London School of Economics
I am currently undertaking research in climate physics and e-science
chief scientist. I  work in the Modelling and Atmospheric Dynamics
group of the Oxford University Physics subdepartment of Atmospheric
and Planetary Physics. I am also a visiting research fellow in the Centre for the
Analysis of Time Series (CATS) at the London School of Economics.
I have a particular interest in research in the following areas:
Distributed computing for large scale modelling research.
Public involvement in climate and environmental research.
E-science techniques for data access and analysis.
Uncertainty analysis in regional climate modelling and forecasting.
Seasonal forecasting of climate on the 3-12 month timescales.
Previous fields of work in which I maintain an interest include:
Renewable energy systems; particularly methods of encouraging the development
of renewable energy sources as large scale energy producers in both western
Paramaterization of gravity waves in GCMs and the forces which drive the
Two approaches to quantifying uncertainty in global temperature changes under different
Constraining climate sensitivity from the seasonal cycle in surface temperature
